decks.notes: This deck focuses on using powerful control elements such as counterspells, removal, and disruptive cards to slow down the opponent's game plan while advancing its own win conditions. By utilizing efficient mana rocks and card draw spells, the deck aims to quickly establish board control and grind out a victory through incremental advantage. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion provides additional value and recursion options. Overall, the deck seeks to outlast the opponent and outmaneuver them with careful resource management and strategic decision-making.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck relies on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to return multiple artifacts to hand and draw cards, while also generating mana and ramping into key combo pieces like Time Vault and Urza's Saga. The deck aims to create an explosive turn where it can generate a large amount of mana, untap Time Vault to take an extra turn, and assemble a powerful board state to overwhelm the opponent quickly. The inclusion of powerful artifacts like Black Lotus, Mana Crypt, and Mana Vault allows for fast and explosive plays to secure victory.

This deck aims to combo off with Underworld Breach to generate infinite mana and use it to repeatedly cast Brain Freeze to mill out the opponent's entire library. It utilizes powerful mana acceleration in the form of Black Lotus and Moxen, along with control elements like Force of Will to protect the combo. Lurrus of the Dream-Den can be used as a companion to provide additional value by recurring key pieces from the graveyard. Overall, the deck aims to quickly assemble its combo while disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck focuses on utilizing Paradoxical Outcome to generate card advantage and mana while also setting up a combo win condition with Time Vault. It includes a lot of fast mana in the form of Moxen and other artifacts, along with powerful spells like Ancestral Recall and Time Walk to help dig for combo pieces. The deck also utilizes Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion for additional value. The goal is to assemble the Time Vault combo quickly while protecting it with counterspells and disrupting the opponent's game plan.

This deck is focused on quickly overwhelming the opponent with aggressive creatures like Hollow One, Vengevine, and Basking Rootwalla, all while utilizing the card advantage and graveyard manipulation offered by Bazaar of Baghdad. The deck also includes multiple free counterspells like Force of Will and Force of Negation to protect its threats, while using cards like Noxious Revival and Squee, Goblin Nabob to fuel its graveyard synergies. With fast starts and disruptive elements like Strip Mine and Wasteland, this deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and control the game from early on.

The main focus of this Vintage 1 vs 1 Combo - Dredge deck is to quickly fill up your graveyard with Dredge creatures and other cards to enable powerful combos and synergies. Utilizing cards like Creeping Chill, Force of Will, and Narcomoeba, along with the Dredge mechanic, allows for explosive plays and massive graveyard recursion. The deck aims to overwhelm the opponent with a rapid and relentless assault, while also disrupting their strategy with cards like Force of Negation and Mindbreak Trap. The key strategy is to efficiently fuel the graveyard and leverage it for powerful plays.

The main focus of this Dimir Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's game plan with a combination of counterspells, removal, and disruptive creatures. By utilizing powerful cards like Force of Will, Drown in the Loch, and Urza's Saga, the deck aims to control the game and outvalue the opponent. With a mix of efficient card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Ponder, along with mana acceleration from artifact ramp like the Moxen and Sol Ring, the deck can generate a strong board presence and overwhelm the opponent with its card advantage and powerful threats.

This deck aims to apply pressure quickly with aggressive creatures while disrupting the opponent's strategy with versatile spells like Force of Will and Assassin's Trophy. It also utilizes powerful card draw and selection tools like Ancestral Recall and Ponder to maintain advantage. The deck includes disruptive cards like Collector Ouphe and Hullbreacher to disrupt the opponent's mana base and card draw. By combining fast threats with disruptive elements, this deck seeks to maintain a proactive game plan while disrupting the opponent's strategy, making it a strong contender in the Vintage 1 vs 1 format.

The deck focuses on disrupting the opponent's strategy through hatebears like Thalia, Guardian of Thraben and Chancellor of the Annex while applying pressure with aggressive creatures like Archon of Emeria and Seasoned Dungeoneer. It also has hate cards like Trinisphere and Wasteland to slow down the opponent's game plan. The deck aims to control the board state and limit the opponent's options while quickly building up a threatening board presence to win the game. The combination of disruptive creatures and fast mana acceleration helps to create a powerful and efficient aggro strategy.

The main focus of this deck is to control the game by utilizing countermagic, removal spells, and powerful artifacts. The deck aims to disrupt the opponent's strategy while building card advantage through card draw and manipulation. It also utilizes the companion mechanic with Lurrus of the Dream-Den for additional value. The deck is designed to outlast and outmaneuver opponents, eventually overwhelming them with powerful spells and creatures. Overall, the strategy revolves around maintaining control of the game and patiently waiting for the right moment to strike.

The deck focuses on using control elements to disrupt the opponent's game plan while using card draw and tutor effects to find and utilize powerful spells like Time Walk and Ancestral Recall. It also utilizes cards like Urza's Saga and Mishra's Bauble to generate incremental advantage over time. The deck aims to outvalue and outmaneuver the opponent through a combination of disruption, card advantage, and efficient threats. It heavily relies on synergies between cards like Lurrus of the Dream-Den and Orcish Bowmasters to consistently control the game and come out on top.

This Vintage 1 vs 1 deck focuses on utilizing Underworld Breach to repeatedly cast powerful spells from the graveyard, generating massive card advantage and overwhelming the opponent with quick and efficient combos. The deck includes disruptive cards like Force of Will and Narset, Parter of Veils to protect the combo, while also running efficient creatures like Sprite Dragon to pressure the opponent. With a combination of card draw, counterspells, and graveyard recursion, this deck aims to quickly assemble its combo pieces and win the game before the opponent can respond.

This deck focuses on using counterspells, disruption, and card advantage to control the board and out-value the opponent. It utilizes fast mana sources like Moxen and Sol Ring to ramp into powerful spells like Time Walk and Dig Through Time. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a Companion allows for additional card advantage and recursion. With a strong mana base and a suite of powerful cards like Force of Will and Ancestral Recall, this UW Control deck aims to dominate the early game and grind out a win in the late game.

The deck focuses on utilizing the graveyard and control elements to disrupt the opponent's strategy while aiming to establish a dominant board presence. It includes a mix of powerful control spells, disruptive cards, and key combo pieces like Time Vault and Manifold Key. The inclusion of Lurrus of the Dream-Den as a companion adds an extra layer of recursion and value to the deck. By controlling the game with counterspells, removal, and efficient card draw, the Dimir Control deck aims to outmaneuver the opponent and secure victory through strategic plays and resource management.

The deck focuses on utilizing graveyard interactions and self-mill to quickly fill the graveyard with creatures like Stinkweed Imp and Golgari Thug, allowing you to trigger effects like Narcomoeba and Prized Amalgam. By using cards like Creeping Chill and Grief, you can disrupt your opponent's strategy while building your own board presence. Force of Will and Force of Negation provide protection for your combo pieces, ensuring you can execute your game plan efficiently. Bazaar of Baghdad is essential for digging through your deck and fueling your graveyard strategy.

This deck focuses on chaining together powerful spells and generating significant card advantage through the use of Paradoxical Outcome. It combines fast mana sources like Black Lotus and Moxen with card draw spells like Ancestral Recall and Ponder to dig through the deck quickly. The inclusion of key combo pieces like Time Vault and Bolas's Citadel allows for explosive turns that can quickly win the game. The deck also includes disruptive elements like Force of Will and Lavinia, Azorius Renegade to protect its combo and disrupt opponent's strategies.
